required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ambulatory Oxygen Effects on Muscles in COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Can Muscle Dysfunction in COPD be Altered by Oxygenation in Patients With Intermittent Hypoxia on Exertion?

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) may develop low oxygen levels, because of damage to their lungs. Long term oxygen therapy (LTOT) is given for at least 15 hours per day, and has established indications and benefits in COPD. However, the indications for and benefits from ambulatory oxygen supplementation (oxygen just when walking or exercising) are less well understood, in part due to heterogeneity of previous study designs, and lack of long term follow up. This is a pilot study of supplementary ambulatory oxygen in COPD, which allows us to ascertain mechanisms of disease by measuring their degree of systemic inflammation pre and post oxygen supplementation, and measuring changes in gene expression in muscles by means of microarray profiling. Secondly, our study will utilise follow up of clinical parameters including home activity monitoring to ascertain medium/long term benefits of oxygen supplementation in a real life setting. Our hypothesis is that exertional hypoxia results in muscle dysfunction and this could be prevented by oxygenation.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Gene expression pattern change between interventions in skeletal muscle biopsy

secondary_outcome.measure: Home activity level as measured by Actigraph

arm_group.description: Oxygen-nitrogen mix equivalent to medical air when inhaled from a cylinder at 2l/min
Ambulatory oxygen delivered at 2l/min on any activity performed by the patient, using a blinded cylinder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinical diagnosis of COPD
- desaturation on exertion
Exclusion Criteria:
- using LTOT
- immobile for other reason than COPD

facility.name: Heart of England NHS Foundation Trust
